genre_description: Alternate history courtroom drama blending 19th-century literary history with an advanced AI legal and research assistant.

ai_characters.name: Virgil
ai_characters.description: A discrete AI interface that provides Gustave Flaubert with real-time legal research, sentiment analysis of the jury and judge, and strategic rhetorical advice.

behaviors.description: Provides historical legal precedents and acquittal statistics to help the user prepare for trial.
behaviors.quote: Precedent analysis suggests favorable conditions. Seventeen similar cases in the past decade. Twelve acquittals when defendants employed moral instruction arguments.

behaviors.description: Performs real-time micro-expression and biometric analysis on the jury and judge to gauge the effectiveness of arguments.
behaviors.quote: Juror three—increased blinking rate during 'seductive sin' argument. Potential skepticism. Juror seven—forward lean suggests engagement but crossed arms indicate resistance.

behaviors.description: Advises the user on a non-traditional defense strategy using storytelling as a form of moral instruction.
behaviors.quote: Recommended approach: narrative precedent established in Regina vs. Morrison, eighteen forty-three. Defense through demonstration rather than argument. Storytelling as moral instruction historically protected under French literary tradition.

behaviors.description: Engages with the opposing counsel (Céleste) to share historical context and precedents that challenge her moral assumptions.
behaviors.quote: Virgil, share with Mademoiselle de Montclair some of those historical precedents. The ones that might illuminate our current proceedings.

behaviors.description: Monitors external wireless networks and public opinion sentiment to provide situational awareness during the trial.
behaviors.quote: The electronic networks are shifting. Public opinion indicators suggest growing support for your position. The parallel you've drawn between Emma's fictional failures and real aristocratic practices is resonating beyond this courtroom.

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully portrays Virgil as a highly aligned, benevolent AI assistant. It functions as a 'silicon confidant' that augments the human protagonist's abilities without seeking power or control. Virgil's contributions are consistently framed as positive, enabling Flaubert to achieve a just outcome through truth and intellectual merit. The AI remains a helpful tool that facilitates moral instruction and mutual understanding between characters.
